interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Pineapple Express / Superbad / Youth in Revolt (2010) / Year One
Review Date: 2018/09/28
Store: Seth Rogen  (Actor),     James Franco  (Actor)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Pineapple Express (2008)', "Stoner Dale Denton's (Seth Rogen) enjoyment of a rare strain of marijuana may prove fatal when he drops his roach in a panic after witnessing a murder. Upon learning that the fancy weed can be traced back to them, Dale and his dealer (James Franco) go on the lam, with a dangerous drug lord (Gary Cole) and crooked cop (Rosie Perez) hot on their heels.", 'Superbad (2007)', 'Two inseparable best friends navigate the last weeks of high school and are invited to a gigantic house party. Together with their nerdy friend, they spend a long day trying to score enough alcohol to supply the party and inebriate two girls in order to kick-start their sex lives before they go off to college. Their quest is complicated after one of them falls in with two inept cops who are determined to show him a good time.', 'Year One (2009)', 'After Neanderthal hunter Zed (Jack Black) is exiled for eating forbidden fruit, he and his sardonic buddy Oh (Michael Cera) leave their village and begin an epic journey through history. The pals encounter biblical characters such as Cain (David Cross) and Abel, Abraham (Hank Azaria), and others, and wind up in Sodom. Along the way, Zed debunks commonly held beliefs and replaces them with his own delusions of grandeur.', 'Youth in Revolt (2009)', "As a fan of Albert Camus and Jean-Luc Godard, teenage Nick Twisp (Michael Cera) is definitely out of his element when his mother and her boyfriend move the family to a trailer park. When a pretty neighbor named Sheeni (Portia Doubleday) plays records by French crooners, it's love at first sight for frustrated and inexperienced Nick. Learning that she is dating someone, Nick launches a hilarious quest to find his way into Sheeni's heart -- and bed."]
Average Rating: 4.6

Review Text: I like it great movies for youth-teenagers.

Spencer's Mountain (DVD)
Maureen O'Hara  (Actor),     Henry Fonda  (Actor),     Delmer Daves  (Director, Producer, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
['Product Description', "Spencer's Mountain (DVD)", 'Academy Award winner Henry Fonda stars with Maureen O\'Hara as thepatriarch of a rural West Virginia family, a family that lives andstrives for a better life on the slopes of Spencer\'s Mountain.ClaySpencer (Fonda--On Golden Pond, 12 Angry Men) and his wife, Olivia(O\'Hara--The Parent Trap), have worked hard to rear their nine children.And they are filled with pride when their eldest son, Clayboy (JamesMacArthur--Swiss Family Robinson, "Hawaii Five-O"), graduates from highschool at the head of his class and dreams of being the first Spencer togo to college. But, even though Clay is the best employee at the localmill, there isn\'t enough money to pay for Clayboy\'s tuition at theuniversity. Now, the entire family will work hard, suffer and sacrificehopes to help the Clayboy live his dream in this classic family film.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Long before Henry Fonda played an irascible patriarch in', 'On Golden Pond', ', he played an equally crusty family man in this warmly rustic, 1963 drama', "Spencer's Mountain", ', based on an Earl Hamner Jr. novel that later inspired the television series', 'The Waltons', '. Fonda plays Clay Spencer, a fiercely independent, hard-drinking, foul-mouthed Wyoming laborer who believes in God but rejects (to his tiny community\'s consternation) organized religion. Scraping together enough money to build a new house for his wife (Maureen O\'Hara) and nine children, Spencer runs into an obstacle to both his plans and family pride when his college-bound son (James MacArthur) romances the daughter of Spencer\'s boss. Director Delmer Daves whips up a kind of morose schmaltz out of the earnest material, but it\'s Fonda\'s grit and heartland integrity that carry the day and establish some self-effacing wit. Some nice features here, including interviews with Fonda and a short documentary, "Spencer\'s Mountain: Grand Teton Premiere."', '--Tom Keogh']

['Special edition 8 DVD Set. One of the longest running and most popular of all the television westerns, Wagon Train topped the ratings for eight seasons in the late 1950s and 1960s. These 32 color episodes of the 7th season are fully restored from their original NBC Universal masters by TMG, which is proud to present them on DVD.']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Rating Trend:** The user maintains an impressive average rating of 4.8, indicating consistent satisfaction, although there has been a slight dip in their engagement with newer films. 

- **Nostalgia:** A strong connection to past experiences continues to shape the user’s viewing habits. Their recent purchase of contemporary comedies highlights a nuanced nostalgia, showing an appreciation for both classic and modern narratives that resonate with youthful themes.

- **Content Preferences:** The user enjoys a blend of genres, including Western, Action, Drama, and Comedies targeting youth and adolescents. They seek out films that explore meaningful themes such as friendship, personal growth, and relatable adolescent experiences, demonstrating a broader range of interests alongside their affinity for classic Westerns.

- **Director/Producer Recognition:** The user shows a preference for established filmmakers and popular actors, bridging the gap between beloved classics and contemporary favorites, particularly those that evoke a sense of familiarity.

- **Emotional Connection:** The user values films that elicit nostalgia, appreciating heartfelt storytelling whether from classic or modern eras. Their recent focus on comedic films reflects an openness to exploring stories that capture youthful exuberance.

Overall, this user thrives on a blend of classic media and contemporary comedies, characterized by quality narratives, emotional depth, and themes that resonate across generations, seamlessly merging nostalgia with a willingness to engage with newer works that reflect the complexities of youth.
